gurmukhi: ਕਰੈ ਨਿਤ ਅਨਰਥੰ ਸਮਰਥੰ ਨ ੲੇਤੀ ॥ ਕਰੈ ਪਾਪ ਤੇਤੋ ਪਰਾਲਬਧ ਜੇਤੀ ॥੫੮॥
transliteration: Darai Nit Anarthan Samarathan Na Etee|| Darai Paap Teto Praalabadh Jeti||58||
translation: They will commit sins beyond their power and will perform wicked deeds in accordance with their conduct.58.

gurmukhi: ਨੲੇ ਨਿੱਤ ਮੱਤੰ ੳੁਠੈ ੲੇਕ ੲੇਕੰ ॥ ਕਰੈ ਨਿੱਤ ਅਨਰਥੰ ਅਨੇਕੰ ਅਨੇਕੰ ॥੫੯॥
transliteration: Nae Nitt Mattan Outhai Ek Ekan|| Darai Nitt Anarthan Anekan Anekan||59||
translation: The new sects will arise always and there will be great misfortunes.59.

gurmukhi: ਦੁਖ ਦੰਦ ਹੈਂ ਸੁਖਕੰਦ ਜੀ ॥ ਨਹੀ ਬੰਦ ਹੈਂ ਜਗਬੰਦ ਜੀ ॥੬੦॥
transliteration: Doukh Dand Hain Soukhkand Jee|| Nahiband Hain Jagband Jee||60||
translation: People will not worship the Lord, the remover of all sufferings.60.

gurmukhi: ਨਹੀ ਬੇਦ ਬਾਕ ਪ੍ਰਮਾਨ ਹੈਂ ॥ ਮਤ ਭਿੰਨ ਭਿੰਨ ਬਖਾਨ ਹੈਂ ॥੬੧॥
transliteration: Nahi Bed Baak Pramaan Hain|| Mat Bhinn Bhinn Bakhaan Hain||61||
translation: The injunctions of Vedas will not be considered quthentic and the people will describe various other religions.61.

gurmukhi: ਨ ਕੁਰਾਨ ਕੋ ਮਤੁ ਲੇਹਗੇ ॥ ਨ ਪੁਰਾਨ ਦੇਖਨ ਦੇਹਗੇ ॥੬੨॥
transliteration: Na Kuraan Ko Mat(u) Leghe|| Na Puraan Dekhan Dehge||62||
translation: No one will accept the advice of the holy Quran and no one will be able to see the Puranas.62.

gurmukhi: ਨਹੀ ੲੇਕ ਮੰਤ੍ਹਿ ਜਾਪ ਹੈਂ ॥ ਦਿਨ ਦ੍ਵੈਕ ਥਾਪਨ ਥਾਪ ਹੈਂ ॥੬੩॥
transliteration: Nahi Ek Mantrab(i) Jaap Hain|| Din Dvaik Thaapan Thaap Hain||63||
translation: No advice or mantra will be followed for more than one two days.63.

gurmukhi: ਕ੍ਰੀਅਤੰ ਪਾਪਣੋ ਕਰਮੰ ਨ ਅਧਰਮੰ ਭਰਮਣੰ ਤ੍ਰਸਤਾੲਿ ॥ ਕੁਕਰਮ ਕਰਮ ਕ੍ਰਿਤੰ ਨ ਦੇਵਲੋਕੇਣ ਪ੍ਰਾਪਤਹਿ ॥੬੪॥
transliteration: Kreetan Paapano Karman Na Adharamannd Bharmanan Trastaae|| Koukaram Karam Kritan Na Devloken Praapatah(i)64||
translation: The performance of wicked deeds will have no fear of adharma and illusions and such people will never be able to enter the abode of gods.64.

gurmukhi: ਰਤਯੰ ਅਰਥ ਅਾਨਰਥੰ ਅਰਥ ਅਰਥੰ ਨ ਬੁਝਯਾਮ ॥ ਨ ਪ੍ਹਰਖ ਬਰਖਣੰ ਧਨੰ ਚਿੱਤੰ ਬਸੀਅੰ ਬਿਰਾਟਕੰ ॥੬੫॥
transliteration: Ratyan Arth Aanarthan Arth Arthan Na Bujhyaam|| Na Praharkh Barkhanan Dhanan Chittan Baseean Biraatakan||65||
translation: The people engrossed in wrong notions will not be able to understand the reality; their desires will not even be satisfied by the rain of wealth and they will still covet for more wealth.65.

gurmukhi: ਮਾਤਵੰ ਮੱਦਯੰ ਕੁਨਾਰੰ ਅਨਰਤੰ ਧਰਮਣੋ ਤ੍ਰੀਅਾੲਿ ॥ ਕੁਕਰਮਣੋ ਕਥਤੰ ਬਦਿਤੰ ਲੱਜਿਣੋ ਤਜਤੰ ਨਰੰ ॥੬੬॥
transliteration: Maatavan Maddyan Kounaaran Anartan Dharmano Treeaae|| Koukamannd Kathtan Baditan Lajjino Tajtan Naran||66||
translation: The people being intoxicated will consider it legitimate to enjoy the wives of others; both utterance and dead will be filled with vices and there will be complete abandonement of shame.66.

gurmukhi: ਸੱਜਯੰ ਕੁਤਸਿਤੰ ਕਰਮੰ ਭਜਤੰ ਤਜਤੰ ਨ ਲਜਾ ॥ ਕੁਵਿਰਤੰ ਨਿਤਪ੍ਰਤਿ ਕ੍ਰਿਤਣੇ ਧਰਮ ਕਰਮੇਣ ਤਿਅਾਗਤੰ ॥੬੭॥
transliteration: Sajjyan Koutasitan Karamannd Bhajatan Tajatan Na Lajaa|| Koubirtan Nitprat(i) Kitane Dharma Karmen Tiaagtan||67||
translation: People will bedeck themselves with wicked deeds and even forsake their shame, though exhibiting it; their daily routine will be full of wicked inclinations and they will abandon righteousness.67.

gurmukhi: ਕੁਕ੍ਰਿਤੰ ਨਿਤ ਕਰਿ ਹੈਂ ਸੁਕ੍ਰਿਤਾਨਨੁ ਸਰ ਹੈਂ ਅਘ ਓਘਨ ਰੁਚਿ ਰਾਚੇ ॥ ਮਾਨਹੈਂ ਨ ਬੇਦਨ ਸਿੰਮ੍ਰਿਤਿ ਕਤੇਬਨ ਲੋਕ ਲਾਜ ਤਜਿ ਨਾਚੇ ॥
transliteration: Koukritan Nit Kar(i) Hain Soukridaanan(u) Sar Hain Agh Oghan Rouch(i) Raache|| Maan-hain Na Bedan Sinmriti Katehan Lok Laaj Taj(i) Naache||
translation: The people will always perform wicked deeds and abandoning good acts they will be inclined greatly towards vicious Karmas; they will not accept Vedas, Katebs and Smritis and dance unashamedly;
